greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of magic and semi-magic squares of order n composed of the numbers from 1 to n^2, counted up to rotations and reflections.
comment: A semi-magic square differs from a magic square in that at least one of its main diagonals does not sum to the magic constant. [_Walter Trump_]
The number of order 4 magic and semi-magic squares was computed by Mutsumi Suzuki, and could be found on his former web site. Mutsumi Suzuki's pages are now hosted by Math Forum at Drexel University.
The number of order 5 magic and semi-magic squares was computed by _Walter Trump_ in March 2000.
The number of order 6 magic and semi-magic squares was calculated by Artem Ripatti in April 2018, and published in his paper dated July 10, 2018. - _William Walkington_, Jul 17 2018
link: Artem Ripatti, On the number of semi-magic squares of order 6, arXiv:1807.02983 [math.CO], 2018. See Table 1 p. 2.
Mutsumi Suzuki, Magic Squares, hosted by Math Forum at Drexel University.
Walter Trump, How many magic squares are there? - Results of historical and computer enumeration.
results.author: _William Walkington_, Mar 30 2016
